Definition: A time management method using 25-minute focused work sessions followed by 5-minute breaks
Example: Work for 25min → 5min break → repeat 4x → 15-30min long break

Definition: A learning method where you explain concepts in simple terms to identify gaps in understanding
Example: Teach the concept to a child using plain language without jargon

Definition: A learning technique with review intervals increasing exponentially based on performance
Example: Review after 1 day → 3 days → 7 days → 14 days → 30 days

Definition: The practice of actively stimulating memory during learning through self-testing
Example: Close notes and write everything you remember before checking

Definition: Mixing different topics or skills during study rather than blocking one topic at a time
Example: Practice math: 5 algebra → 5 geometry → 5 calculus instead of 30 algebra

Definition: Generating explanations for why facts are true by asking "why" questions
Example: Ask "Why does this make sense?" when learning new concepts

Definition: Combining visual and verbal information to enhance memory
Example: Draw diagrams while taking notes or create mind maps

Definition: The idea that some difficulty improves long-term learning
Example: Struggling with retrieval attempts strengthens memory more than easy review

Definition: Thinking about one's own thinking and learning processes
Example: Regularly ask "Do I understand this? What don't I know?"

Definition: Managing the amount of mental effort required to process information
Example: Break complex topics into smaller chunks; reduce extraneous information
